transcript:
to the war, or was he sad at leaving his wife? perhaps both, but evidently he did not wish to be seen in that mood, for hearing foot- steps in the passage he hurriedly unclasped his hands, stopped at a table as if tying the cover of the small box, and assumed his usual tran- quil and impenetrable expression. It was the heavy tread of Princess Mary that he heard. 
"I hear you have given orders to harness," she cried, panting (she had apparently been running), "and I did so wish to have another t
